days.overview: The Bible begins with 'Elohim' (God) creating the heavens and earth. This name emphasizes God's power, might, and supreme authority as Creator.
days.reflection: What does God as Creator mean to you? How does His creative power affect your view of Him? What has He created in your life?
days.prayer: Worship Elohim, the all-powerful Creator of heaven and earth.

days.overview: After God provides a ram instead of Isaac, Abraham names the place 'Yahweh-Yireh' (The LORD Will Provide). God sees needs and provides for His people.
days.reflection: How has God provided for you? What needs are you trusting Him to meet? What does God's provision teach about His character?
days.prayer: Thank Yahweh-Yireh for His faithful provision and trust Him with current needs.

days.overview: After healing bitter waters, God reveals Himself as 'Yahweh-Rapha' (The LORD Who Heals). He promises health to those who obey Him.
days.reflection: What healing do you need from God? How has He healed you? What does God as healer mean beyond physical healing?
days.prayer: Ask Yahweh-Rapha to heal you physically, emotionally, and spiritually.

days.overview: David declares 'Yahweh-Rohi' (The LORD is my Shepherd), trusting God's guidance, provision, and protection. A shepherd cares intimately for his sheep.
days.reflection: How is God your Shepherd? Where is He leading you? How do you experience His care and protection?
days.prayer: Thank Yahweh-Rohi for shepherding you and ask Him to guide you today.

days.overview: After encountering God's angel, Gideon builds an altar named 'Yahweh-Shalom' (The LORD is Peace). Even in turmoil, God gives peace.
days.reflection: Where do you need God's peace? How does knowing God as peace affect anxiety? What peace has He given you?
days.prayer: Ask Yahweh-Shalom to fill you with His peace in every circumstance.

days.overview: God promises a righteous Branch who will be called 'Yahweh-Tsidkenu' (The LORD Our Righteousness). This prophecy points to Christ, our righteousness.
days.reflection: How is Jesus your righteousness? What does it mean to have righteousness not your own? How does this free you?
days.prayer: Thank Yahweh-Tsidkenu for being your righteousness through Jesus Christ.

days.overview: Ezekiel's vision of the restored city ends with its name: 'Yahweh-Shammah' (The LORD is There). God's presence defines His people's ultimate blessing.
days.reflection: What does God's presence mean to you? How do you experience Him being 'there'? How does His presence change everything?
days.prayer: Thank Yahweh-Shammah for His presence with you and worship Him as Emmanuel, God with us.
